thread.title: UIL suspends Jay players, former assistant coach

author: Ben Baby
title: UIL suspends Jay players, former assistant coach
text:

Rojas was immediately ejected from the game after hitting the official but Moreno was allowed to stay on the field. On the next play, Moreno drew a penalty for a late hit on a Marble Falls player and was subsequently ejected. The attorney for Robert Watts, the referee who was hit by two Jay football players during a game last week, told NBC’s “Today” on Wednesday morning Watts is under a doctor’s care and is the victim of a “heinous crime.” He also said allegations by the players that Watts made racial slurs during the game are unfounded. Photo: A John Jay High School football coach talks to some of the school's players Tuesday afternoon, Sept. 8, 2015 during the first practice since two of their varsity players, Victor Rojas and Mike Moreno, were suspended indefinitely, pending investigation, over violently hitting a referee at the end of last Friday's road game in Marble Falls. 9. On Sept. 18, Moreno and Rojas appeared on "Good Morning America" to discuss the incident. The teens said the attack stemmed from a directive given to them by assistant Mack Breed. “You put your trust into this grown-up, this guardian, your coach, who’s been there for me. ... I trust him. I did what I was told,” Moreno told host George Stephanopoulos. Photo: “Good Morning America” host George Stephanopoulos talks with Jay football players Michael Moreno and Victor Rojas and their attorney, Jesse Hernandez. The players say they were following a coach’s instructions when they struck a ref in a game this month. 10. On Sept. 18, Moreno and Rojas appeared on "Good Morning America" to discuss the incident. They didn’t mean to do this,” Hernandez said. 11. According to a report issued by ESPN's John Barr , the John Jay secondary coach, Mack Breed, admitted he "directed the students to make the referee pay for his racial comments and calls." Breed, who starred as a dual-threat quarterback at Jay before moving on to play safety at the University of Missouri from 2004-2008, has been coaching at the school since 2010. Photo: Jay High School football standouts, quarterback Mack Breed, left, and offensive tackle Aaron Saunders pose after signing their letters of intent to the Missouri Tigers in 2004. 12. According to a report issued by ESPN's John Barr , the John Jay secondary coach, Mack Breed, admitted he "directed the students to make the referee pay for his racial comments and calls." Breed, who ... more Photo: Express-News File Photo UIL suspends Jay players, former assistant coach 1 / 18 Back to Gallery 
The former Jay assistant coach involved in the attack on an official was suspended through the 2016-17 school year and issued a two year probation on Thursday. 
Mack Breed was sentenced at Thursday's University Interscholastic League State Executive Committee meeting. Breed testified on Thursday and said he did not direct Jay senior Michael Moreno and sophomore Victor Rojas to attack umpire Robert Watts during Jay's Sept. 4 game against Marble Falls. 
Moreno and Rojas have been suspended for the rest of the school year. Rojas, a sophomore, will have to appear before the committee before he can participate in UIL activities, the committee ruled Thursday. 
Both committee decisions on the assistant coach and the players was unanimous. Latest Headlines
